result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L Meenen Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:30 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver. Defendant has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

TIME SERVED.

Court orders the court costs $470.53 and restitution $175.32 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court adjourned at 1:34 p.m.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2016, cancelled - Defendant has revocation hearing on December 20, 2016
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on December 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gary L Meenen Jr
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2016)
Prior: 163 W Berlin St, Berlin, WI 54923

8:48 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to charge, will recommend probation.  Defendant will accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year, concurrent to any other probation the defendant is serving.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-restitution - $175.32
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m.
